alert.note: Alert for Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Coastal York; Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 14 at 11:38PM EDT until March 15 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM CONTINUES TONIGHT... .Low pressure over the Gulf of Maine will continue to produce snow along with strong, gusty winds through tonight. Additional snowfall accumulations will be relatively minor compared with the snow we`ve experienced thus far, with most snow being light to at times moderate in intensity, however snowfall accumulated on trees and power lines combined with wind may still lead to additional power outages. Travel will continue to be hazardous due to areas of blowing snow as well. Snow will continue to diminish in coverage and intensity through Wednesday morning, with light showers persisting over the mountains through the day. Winds on the other hand will remain gusty through Wednesday with gusts to around 30-35 mph. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy, wet snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Maine. Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until Noon EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Light to moderate snow along with blowing snow will combine to create low visibility and dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds combined with the weight of snow will likely bring down some tree branches and lead to power outages.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org Persons should consider delaying all travel. Motorists should use extreme caution if travel is absolutely necessary.
